description.plain: Khalif Malik Ibn Shaman Brown (born June 7, 1995 in Inglewood, California), better known by his stage name Swae Lee, is an American rapper from Tupelo, Mississippi. He is one half of the duo Rae Sremmurd alongside his brother Slim Jxmmi.

body.plain: Khalif Malik Ibn Shaman Brown (born June 7, 1995 in Inglewood, California), better known by his stage name Swae Lee, is an American rapper from Tupelo, Mississippi. He is one half of the duo Rae Sremmurd alongside his brother Slim Jxmmi.

songs.full_title: Won’t Be Late by Swae Lee (Ft. Drake)
songs.title: Won’t Be Late

description.plain:
On “Won’t Be Late,” Tupelo rapper Swae Lee enlists the help of Canadian star Drake for a melodic banger. The two artists team up to discuss a relationship with a girl that they are taking slow.

A snippet of the track first surfaced in May 2019, when fashion mogul Virgil Abloh previewed the collaboration. On August 14th, 2019, Mike WiLL Made-It teased the song’s imminent release on Instagram.  Two days later, Swae Lee confirmed the track on Instagram, where he revealed the release date and cover art. The song was officially released on August 16th, 2019, along with the official lyrics video.

The track serves as the lead single for Swae Lee’s second solo album Swaecation 2, along with “Sextasy,” and marks the second collaboration between the two main artists, following Travis Scott’s August 2018 track “SICKO MODE.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Won’t Be Late” by Swae Lee on Genius

songs.full_title: Hurt to Look by Swae Lee
songs.title: Hurt to Look

description.plain:
“Hurt to Look” is Swae Lee’s first single off Swaecation, his solo side of the triple-disc SremmLife 3 project.

It was previewed on Feb 27th on Swae Lee’s Instagram and released on March 1st on all streaming platforms.

https://www.instagram.com/p/Bft9vFgBtVB/

songs.full_title: Offshore by Swae Lee (Ft. Young Thug)
songs.title: Offshore

description.plain:
Track #4 on Swaecation finds Swae taking a backseat and handling the hooks as none other than fellow Atlanta artist, Young Thug, who provides one lengthy verse as well as the intro and joint-hook duties.

The song gives off a relaxed summer vibe as the album title and song title would suggest.

The term ‘offshore’ describes an area that is distanced from the sea, which attributes to Thug and Swae’s luxurious and glamorous lifestyle. ‘Offshore’ also describes business done overseas in foreign countries. This could allude to both artists’ fan bases outside of the US.

This serves as a nice set up for the next track, “Guatemala.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Offshore” by Swae Lee on Genius
